short of length around off, gets on his toes and blocks
short of length angling in, Pujara moves just towards the off side and lets it go behind his back
short again, but well outside off this time, left alone
tossed up, on off to start with rather than his seventh stump line, defended on the front foot towards midwicket
very full and flicked through midwicket on the front foot
no need to dance down the track to that one, a bit shorter outside off, and he goes on the back foot to punch crisply through cover
nicely tossed up outside off, dipping on him, but solidly defended on the front foot
room outside off again, and stroked through point by staying legside of the ball
good length tossed up outside off, gets right behind the ball and punches it to the bowler's left
on target straightaway as he normally is. Pujara defends outside off on the front foot
perfect length and in that channel outside off, defended on the front foot again
fuller and on the stumps, patted back to the bowler while he's a bit off balance due to the length, which is yorker-length almost
keeps it on the stumps, Pujara gently pats it towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, pushed to point
nipping into him from a hard length but Pujara solidly behind it to defend
length on the stumps, defended back
digs it in short on leg stump, Rahane thought about going for it it but then pulled out of the shot in time as the ball sailed well over his left shoulder
length on the stumps, nudged towards mid-on
length, attacking the stumps, steered towards point
too full on the pads and nicely tucked through square leg, to the right of the fielder in the circle
back of a length outside off, pushed with bat away from body towards point
tight line and length, nibbling at off stump, defended into the offside from the crease
fuller on the stumps, patted to short leg
good length, hint of movement into him, but he's solid in defending it towards point
bouncer, but veering down leg side. He thought of going for it but the ball was too far down leg
length ball, angling into him, tucked towards midwicket

that one spat up off a length. Outside off, and Rahane was surprised by the bounce, ended up having to get his hands up quickly towards ribs and dropping the ball down in defence. Hit him on the splice of the bat and he had to take one hand off
fuller outside off, defended
bouncer, on target and Pujara ducks under in a hurry
length coming into him from the angle, tucked to square leg
slips in another short one, trying to strangle him down the leg side, but Pujara is good with his hands, doesn't follow the ball and lets it hiss past his ribs
back of a length on a fifth stump line, left alone
another short one but this is easier to duck under, which Pujara does
fuller on the stumps, comes on the front foot to nudge it through square leg
another short one - seems to be a definite plan to Pujara - but it's short enough for him to see it coming and bend down to let it pass
fuller on the stumps, defended calmly
back of a length on off, patted back down the pitch
ooh that one came in a bit from outside off, but Pujara keeps it out with a soft, defensive prod. Got an inside edge onto pad and it rolls away into the offside
goes a bit wider of the crease to slant it more in, Pujara equal to the task, pushes it towards midwicket
lovely shot. Got a bad ball and took a full toll. Half volley outside off, and he leans into the punch, gets it very sweetly and threads it through cover
length on the stumps, tapped towards mid-off
length on middle and leg, patted towards short leg
and another short one, into Rahane's ribs on leg stump, and he does well to pat it down
length on the stumps, pushed to cover
connects with the pull this time. Another short ball, rising up to his shoulders, he transfers weight back nicely and swivels, keeps the pull down. Deep square leg fields
strays in length a bit, too full and straight and Rahane clips it through midwicket on the front foot
takes on the short ball again. Both times he has done that, the ball has been within hitting range. Keeps the pull shot down and controlled once again too, to deep square leg
back of a length nibbling at off stump, defended solidly
length coming into him a tad, tucks it off his thigh pad to square leg
snorter, and well done to Pujara to sway out of the way. On target and quick, rising up at his helmet on off, Pujara drops his gloves and gets his head out of the way
back of a length on off, defended to cover
length outside off, goes back and punches to point
a bit flatter, keeps the same line outside off, this time Rahane uses wrists to work it to midwicket
tossed up fuller outside off, comes on the front foot to defend

was that a chance? Harsh to call it that. Lyon's drift gets the inside edge onto pad as Rahane is coming forward to defend, the ball balloons over Wade at short leg. He leaps up but can only get a fingertip to the ball
tossed up, pushed into the offside

boom. Rahane skips down the track and unleashes a powerful thump down the ground, carries all the way over long-on. This was tossed up again on leg, he made a wee bit of room, and the connection was so good, the ball carried over without even a full flourish of the bat
length coming into him, tucked to square leg
bouncer, sees it coming and ducks under
full on off, gets his bat down in time to push it with soft hands to mid-off. Calls him through for a well-judged quick single

he's chopped on. Pat Cummins, as he does so often, has produced something. Back of a length outside off, and jagged in appreciably. Too close to cut, which is what Rahane was looking to do, and didn't bounce as much as he expected it to either. Ends up getting the bottom edge of the bat to crash into the stumps
bouncer first up, but down leg, easy enough to duck under
back of a length nipping into him, gets right behind it to defend it back
good length, spinning into him, pops into the air as he looks to turn it around the corner. No one at leg slip, so it's safe
stays in his crease and flicks it to backward square leg

tossed up on off, lobs to short leg. Australia are reviewing this, they think they've got him bat pad.. The umpire was not interested in the appeal and Pujara didn't look flustered either. Nice loop and dip, pitches and turns past his defensive push. Doesn't look like there is an inside edge onto pad on that one. Nothing on hot spot and nothing on snicko either. They check the lbw too, and the ball is spinning past leg stump. Pujara stays
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and works it to square leg
giving it a fair bit of rip is Lyon and getting some turn too. Defended from the crease
tossed up a bit fuller, so Pujara is able to steer it through gully, coming on the front foot and opening the face of the bat
length on off, defended
length on a fourth stump line, left alone
fuller on off, defended on the front foot
full outside off, solid in defence
good length angling in outside off, but Pujara knows where his off stump is and that ball is not one that is going to threaten it. Leaves it alone
bouncer over leg stump, ducks under
tossed up fuller outside off, comes on the front foot to drive to mid-on. Comes off the inside half of the bat
tossed up and drifting into off, goes right back and turns it off his pads to square leg
tossed up outside off again, Vihari gets behind it to pat it towards mid-on
moves across to this fuller one and taps it to midwicket
tossed up, comes on the front foot to work it to midwicket
flatter on off, moves across and plays it to backward square leg
length on off, defended from the crease
too full and on the pads, Pujara clips it nicely through square leg
bouncer over the stumps, ducks under
full on off, defended on the front foot. Seemed a hint of late swing there, reverse perhaps
another short one, this time going past leg stump, ducks under again
full outside off, steered to point on the front foot
tossed up on off, gets behind it and punches towards mid-on
fuller on off, comes forward and works it to backward square leg
keeps it on a tight length, getting the ball into a nice loop too. Vihari pats it to mid-on
slips it down legside, and Vihari lets it go
slightly shorter in length and he goes right back to punch it towards extra cover. The single is on, and they take it
down the track he comes and pushes at it, not sure if that came off bat but it was clear of the silly point fielder, just past his outstretched hand to his right
oooh that was close to off stump. Coming into him outside off, but the length makes this 'leave-able', which Vihari does. Goes over the stumps
hint of swing back into him, fuller ball so he's able to clip it off his pads. Can't beat midwicket
length ball angled into him, tries to tuck it while moving across, but short leg fields to his right
bouncer, but too short and easy enough to duck under
good length outside off, left alone
fuller outside off, defended to cover

tossed up, Pujara shows nimble footwork to get to the pitch and drive it back down the ground. Takes it on the half volley and finds the long-on boundary. Mid-on was a bit wide so he couldn't cut it off
good length from Lyon, Pujara was looking to step down again, but couldn't quite get to the pitch and ended up defending
and Pujara's use of his feet means Lyon bowls it too short this time. Pujara's waiting on the back foot and cuts it nicely through point to collect another boundary

dances down the track again, gets to the pitch of it and whips it from outside off through midwicket. excellent running as they take a third. Vihari had to hustle for that last run but Pujara judged it well when he called for it
tossed up outside off, solid forward defensive block
tossed up again, comes on the front foot to clip to mid-on
full on the stumps, tailing in, defended on the front foot
good length on off, solidly behind it to defend
fuller on the stumps, turned to square leg
short ball, but misdirected well down legside. Pujara doesn't even need to move to avoid it
fuller on the stumps, nudged towards square leg
full on the stumps, nicely behind it to defend
bit too full outside off, pushed back to Lyon off the front foot
goes back this time for the length ball and defends it to leg with the turn
goes back and across again, this one turning further towards leg and he nudges it fine for two
nice and teasing length outside off, half a forward lean and he defends to leg

shouts of 'catch' as Matthew Wade leaps again at short leg and the ball evades him again! Clear inside edge off Vihari, as he looked to defend off the front foot and edged the ball onto the pad before it ballooned just beyond Wade's leap
bit of turn into the batsman, he pushes it back with a forward lean again
swinging into Pujara from length around off, he closes the face of the bat and finds midwicket
too full on off, Pujara presents the straight bat and merely pushes it down the ground past Hazlewood's dive that also beats mid-off for four
bit over pitched again towards the stumps, Pujara defends it back this time
short of length and angling in, Pujara goes on his toes and keeps it down on leg
angling into him again from around off on length, he stays back and defends
a muted appeal from Paine for a catch down leg, umpire not interested. Much shorter and angling down leg, Pujara looked to play and then withdraw his shot so it went off his hip
fullish around off stump, driven down to mid on
touch wider but with turn, he goes across on the back foot and defends carefully
turning into the stumps again from length outside off, tucked to leg and blocked by short leg
shorter outside off, he stays on leg and punches it to cover for one
comes down to get to the pitch of the ball and flicks it with the turn beyond square leg for two more
flatter at 94kmh towards the stumps, he stays back and whips to square leg
bangs it in short outside off, Vihari lets it go
targets the stumps from length around off, Vihari covers the line and blocks it
looked like reverse swing into the stumps, Vihari stays back and helps it along towards leg gully
another short ball, this one over the head and he ducks under it easily
towards the stumps again, he defends off the back foot
well outside off to end the over, no movement, and Vihari punches it to extra cover
comes down the pitch again, takes it on the full and whips the ball to mid-on for a quick single

that's a direct hit from mid-off and Vihari is barely even trying to drag his bat in! Vihari came down the pitch, pushed the ball down to mid-off and set off for the quick single that probably didn't exist because he was about three-fourths down the pitch when Hazlewood struck the stumps with a direct hit. What an effort from Hazlewood. He put in a dive to his right and somehow threw the ball while falling on the ground and even hit the stumps! Could be the lack of scoring from Vihari that pushed him to go for this
Pujara comes down and pads the ball outside off, well down the pitch, and there's an appeal from Australia
stays back and punches the ball to cover
stays back again, this one turns into him and he defends it back
on the back foot, ball turns into him and he offers the straight bat
full toss, Pant won't mind that, and he pushed it down
back of length outside off, he opens the face of the bat towards gully and finds the gap to get off the mark
just outside off this time, he opens the face again and finds gully this time
bit too full, Pant leans into it and drives this to mid-off
bangs in the short ball around off stump, Pant sways out of the line and lets it go. Oh, Starc also has a few words for Pant after that ball. Pant doesn't reply
just short of length and Pant punches that nicely through the cover point region in the gap for two more
well outside off, Pujara plonks his front foot well forward and offers the pad
goes on the back foot this time and gets one by pushing into the covers
gets some room outside off and Pant uses his hard hands and powerful arms to cut that away fiercely for a cracking four
drives this one gently into the covers for one
nicely tossed up, Pujara dances down and drives with the turn wide of mid-on and gets one more as the fielder dives to his right
length delivery outside off, Pant goes back and defends it back
bangs in a short of length ball into Pujara, he blocks it back
angling into the abdomen, he helps it along towards midwicket
length delivery this time around off and middle, Pujara has his head down and blocks
well outside off now, easy leave
bangs it in again from short of length, Pujara works it towards cover point
more drivable length outside off, teasing line and length, but he lets it go
outside off without much turn, he lets it go
closer to the stumps and touch fuller, he blocks this time
goes a bit wider while delivering and Pant blocks this in front of the stumps
goes back to outside off and Pant leaves again
touch shorter and hint of room again, Pant slices that for one
too short outside off, and plenty of room for Pujara to pounce on that and punch it away for a cracking boundary. Rare poor ball from Lyon
in the driving zone and Pant pushes that into the covers for a quick second
shorter ball towards the hips, he helps it to fine leg
short all into the batsman from wide of the crease, Pujara doesn't offer a shot and gets hit on the arm guard

bangs in a short ball again, Pant is hurried up, he tries to play and at the same time take evasive action and ends up getting some glove as it balloons behind square on leg. Got him into an awkward position for sure
short of length and outside off, left alone
short of length towards off stump, Pujara hops and blocks it back

loud, loud appeal for caught behind down the leg side off Labuschagne's first ball! Paine takes the catch and looks very confident, he quickly consults the bowler and takes a review. Slow motion shows the ball is very close to the glove as Pant tries to pull a short ball, nothing on HotSpot, and no spike on Snicko either. There's a bit of gap between ball and glove in fact. So it stays not out
around length on off, Pant takes out the big and powerful slog sweep and smacks that with the turn to the midwicket region for four
better length, gets some turn into Pant who gets a thick inside edge to leg
turns it away from Pujara outside off, he leans forward and defends
nice turn outside off, Pujara leaves it and lets it turn away
drives this fuller delivery straight to cover
outside off on length, Pant defends it back
touch wider outside off, he steers it towards point
there's the short ball but it's wide outside off and he takes out the upper cut to send that flying over the third man region for four more
this short ball down the leg side which Pant moves away from happily
the bouncer around off stump this time, good bounce so Pant sways away from the line easily
nearly taken at short leg! Bangs this in towards Pant's ribs, he tucks it awkwardly to leg and it just goes past the fielder's left hand
short and turning in from around the wicket, Pant pulls and hits short leg
loopy full toss and Pant pushes it to leg for one
comes down the track and drives it with the turn for a single
fullish on the stumps, helped along to leg for one more
nice turn outside off, Pujara lets it go and it even goes past Paine, but Smith does well to grab it with his left hand
left alone again outside off, Paine takes it this time after it turns
outside the off stump with the angle and Pant leaves it alone
stifled appeal for lbw as Pant is hit around the leg stump line, but it pitched outside the leg stump
oh, short ball that rose towards Pant and he ducked under it just in time
back of length around middle and off, Pant stays back and defends close to the pitch
around the off stump again, keeps Pant on his toes as he defends this one on off
on off stump, Pant defends it towards mid off and realises there's a quick single. Calls for it a bit late but makes it well in time
turns this one down the leg side past Pant
better line around off, there's turn and Pant blocks it
pretty wide of the crease, this one is fuller and Pan drives it to long on
turning it away from the batsman, punched into the covers for one
turning it in sharply from around the wicket, good bounce too and Pant does well to tuck it between short leg and leg slip
innocuous delivery outside off, left alone
short of length outside off, left alone by Pant
angles it away further from outside off, easy leave for Pant
well pitched short ball, very close to the off stump line, it rises on Pant and goes just past his face as he almost drops his hands and turns his head towards the keeper. And then smiles
outside off on length, he helps it towards point
decent pace and carry outside off, and outside enough to be left alone
ends the session with a bouncer and Pant ducks under it
tossed up outside off, padded away to slip
fuller on the stumps, stays back to it and plays it on the legside
nice drift from Lyon - wonder if that will play a part in when the second new ball is taken? - and Pujara defends from the crease on off
fuller and straighter, comes on the front foot to work it towards midwicket
good length, stayed back to whip it. Hung in the air for a mite before bouncing to midwicket
length, stays back and whips it off his pads through backward square leg
starts off with an almost yorker length ball tailing into him, ends up on the pads and is flicked through square
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length but slightly too far down leg side, which means Pujara can leave it well alone. Was on a fifth stump line to a left-hander
fuller on leg stump now, and shows the full face of the bat to pat it towards mid-on
length ball in the channel, left alone.
fuller but angling well across him and an easy leave outside off. appreciable bounce, as Paine gathers it head high
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
full on off, Pant stays legside of it and plants his front foot forward to drive with authority, but can't go past extra cover
full on the stumps, shuffles a bit and taps it to midwicket

chopped to the third man boundary. Short ball outside off, and Pant almost seemed to decide on the shot at the last moment, was shaping to cut it but then held himself back a bit and sort of guided it through a fourth slip region
length outside off, left alone
good length, going across him, he shoulders arms and lets it through
length ball, going across him, left alone outside off
full but still on a fifth stump and with his angle from over the wicket, that's a straightforward leave everytime
length on the stumps, stays beside it and punches it to point
slips in the bouncer that time, on leg stump, but short enough to spot early and duck under
good length, gets it on the stumps and Pujara brings out the textbook forward defence
back of a length on the stumps, gets this to zip past Pujara, who was half forward to defend. Bat close to body though so no danger of the edge coming into play with the ball moving away
fuller outside off, Pant leans into the drive, not sure the weight transfer was smooth enough but he gets enough on it to stroke through cover
past the outside edge. Pujara's hands are so good, he doesn't follow it. Pitched in the channel and held it's line. Pujara stays inside the line which is why the edge has not come into play
length on the stumps, blocked into the legside
too full and on the pads, clipped to square leg
fuller on the stumps, defended solidly from the crease
bouncer outside off, he arches his back to keep out of the way
length outside off, defended
yorker on the stumps, driven to mid-on
beaten. Inviting the drive outside off, and angling the ball in. Pant is a bit too legside of the ball and the stride is not big enough to meet it, goes for the drive and misses
this one is straighter, and Pant tries to work it off his pads, but doesn't connect

short one, and Pant goes for the pull but cops a blow on the arm. Painful. He's down on the ground now, physio coming out. This was coming into him and up to rib high, he expected it higher though which is why he couldn't connect with the pull and the ball pinged into his left forearm.

It is indeed short but Pant isn't fazed, and essays the same shot he tried the previous ball - except he connects this time. Controls it well enough too, keeping it on the ground as deep square leg runs to his right to field
oooh, was tempted into having a feel for it. Full ball, well outside off on a seventh stump line and Pant drawn into driving at it with feet nowhere close to the ball. Doesn't get the edge
this one was bowled closer to off, in the channel, but Pant shoulders arms
good bouncer and well dealt with. Rising straight up at his throat, but Pant stays still and defends to keep it down
full outside off, nice stride out and Pant meets the ball well, punching it to extra cover
back of a length on off, solid in defence is Pant. On the back foot and behind the line to block
length on off, again nicely behind it to defend
good length in the channel, left alone

and now Pujara wears the ball on his body. Sharp bouncer from Cummins again, and Pujara can't get out of the way so he merely turns his body and cops the blow on his left shoulder. Phlegmatic as ever after being hit

and perfect riposte, in Pujara fashion. Length ball outside off, opens the face while coming on the front foot, plays with soft hands too, and gets the timing perfect for the ball to race to the third man boundary
length coming into him, clipped to square leg
fullish on the stumps, tapped towards mid-on
bouncer outside off now, but Pujara has to just stay still and tilt his head slightly out of the way to avoid that one
another sharp bouncer but Pant does okay with it, though in a bit of a tangle. Spits up from back of a length to his grille and Pant gets hands up and fends it down towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, nudged through midwicket to raise afantastic fifty for Pujara. Battled all the way through it but has stood firm.
fuller outside off, strides on the front foot to defend towards point

taken at first slip. Pant has not been his normal self since that blow to the forearm, and is drawn into another expansive drive to a full ball outside off. Edge flies to Warner's left at first slip, and he holds on. Important breakthrough for Australia, with the new ball

bouncer outside off first up, but Jadeja doesn't need to get anywhere near it. Staredown after the ball though, with Jadeja piercing Hazlewood with his gaze and Hazlewood returning it with interest. Ends in smiles for both
fullish outside off, defended to cover
bouncer, but directed well down legside

jaffa and Pujara is caught behind. Back of a length, and he put some shoulder into that as he got it to bounce appreciably. Pujara has been so good at not letting his hands follow the ball but there was nothing much he could do about this. Tries to rise up with it to defend but the ball takes a thin edge off the shoulder of the bat and goes to Paine. Magnificent bowling by Cummins
ill-directed bouncer, way down leg. Ashwin doesn't need to get anywhere near it
and that's gone through him. Just about missed the outside edge. Full ball on off, straightens and he's left feeling for it
fuller on off, comes on the front foot to steer to gully.
fuller on off, tailing into him, played into the legside on the front foot
full outside off, comes on the front foot to punch crisply to extra cover, where Starc fumbles and allows a single
length outside off, on the front foot to punch to mid-off
short ball, down leg again, Ashwin ducks slightly to let it pass
shot. Elegance from Ashwin, with a peachy cover drive to a full ball outside off

back of a length, uneven bounce almost got Ashwin in a tangle. He was expecting it to rise to his ribs and had to hurriedly adjust as the ball came to just above waist. Manages to tap it down to the leg side
fuller, clipped through midwicket
on length and coming in towards the stumps, Jadeja pushes it back
little shorter and angling in from outside off, Jadeja taps it towards cover point and wants one but is sent back
there's the short ball and Jadeja ducks under it
targets the stumps once again from just outside off, Jadeja pushes it to mid-on this time
and another short ball angling in and rising towards Jadeja, he ducks once again
back of length and coming in towards the batsman, he hops on the back foot and defends it back
turning in from outside off, Ashwin defends on the back foot
comes down to take the ball on the full and drives that nicely past mid-off for his second boundary
goes back again and helps the ball to leg with the turn
lets the ball turn into him and defends it to the right of short leg
forward lean this time well outside off and he blocks it
touch tighter, Ashwin leans forward once again for the length delivery outside off and blocks
slightly full outside off and slanting away, he leaves it alone

looks like another run-out, Ashwin falls short this time! Jadeja dug out this half volley to the right of mid-off and called for the single quickly but Ashwin, not the quickest among the wickets, doesn't give it his all and Cummins does well to throw the ball to the keeper's end
welcomes Saini with a bouncer, it's quick and he ducks under it
towards the pads now and Saini gets some bat and pad to get off the mark with a single to fine leg
he hops on the back foot and defends the short of length ball
just outside off on length, Jadeja lets it go because of the angle
lunges forward at the last second and defends the ball to off
goes on the back foot this time and lets the ball turn in, defends again
nicely bowled, Saini neither forward nor back this time, and defends on off again
bit more towards middle and leg, Saini goes back and defends
full and flighted on middle, Saini drives it hard and back, and Lyon collects it quickly
turning in from outside off, Saini defends on off and he keeps strikes with a single
short ball as expected but it's down leg and Saini doesn't have to move much
back of length on the stumps, Saini defends on his toes and a misfield at cover from Pucovski gives them two
quick short ball, Saini lobs it towards the vacant short cover region, Australians excited, but he's safe
cranks it up to 145kmh, another nasty short ball and this time Saini gets the top of the bat towards gully, and sends Jadeja back. Starc has a big smile on his face
this is like catching practice. Similar short ball like two balls ago from Starc, Saini is cramped up and hands a dolly to short cover
it's a bouncer and Bumrah ducks under it quickly
gets just a bit of room, and Jadeja rocks back to cut that behind square for a handy boundary
nicely flighted around off, he lunges forward and blocks this time
more towards middle now, leans forward and blocks again
on length and quicker at 90kmh outside off, he cuts to point
Lyon errs on the pads, and Jadeja happily nudges it to deep midwicket. Settles for one even though there might have been two
he does well to lean forward to the pitch off the ball and block it
starts with a short ball that's slanting across, he lets it go
proper bouncer, this one closer to Jadeja but he can duck under it easily

another direct hit, third run out of the innings because Jadeja wanted two. Jadeja flicked this one off the pads just past short leg and he easily got one but he wanted one more to retain strike, and turned around quickly, but Labuschagne did well to quickly pick up and fire a throw at the bowler's end where Bumrah is short
short ball, not a bouncer, Jadeja pulls and misses
little full, Jadeja goes after it and slogs it down the ground past mid-on and picks up four
outside off, Jadeja heaves again and this time gets an edge thick enough to beat Paine's dive to the right side for another four
short ball to end the over, Jadeja drops his hands at the end. Siraj on strike for next over
short ball for Siraj and he lets it go
wonderful delivery at 141kmh, on length and only a whisker outside off, Siraj drives without moving his feet and misses it
expects the short ball and ducks under it quickly
tries the yorker this time but it's a low full toss and Siraj pushes it down the ground for two
that's a cracking cut from Siraj! Makes room early for the ball outside off, and scythes it away past point. He'll be pleased with that
bouncer to end the over, he ducks under it. Six from the over
starts with the short ball, Jadeja attacks with a hook and he gets enough on that to beat fine leg and it lands just inside the boundary rope
goes for a big heave, doesn't middle it at all and the ball goes high right behind the keeper towards the boundary. Lyon chases it from third man and Jadeja hurries back for the second
length delivery outside off, Jadeja pushes it into the covers and that's another quick two
awkward short ball towards the ribs, makes Jadeja hop and he defends.
almost taken at short leg! Jadeja flicks that and it went quickly to Labuschagne's right, he did very well to get a hand to it but it didn't stick in
short ball outside off, Jadeja ramps and it's hurrying towards the boundary where Lyon does very well to slide and save a few. Jadeja keeps strike
Jadeja makes room early for the short ball and scythes that fine to third man. They decide against the single
the short ball barrage continues, Jadeja lets this one go
goes for the cut outside off and misses this time
short ball rising on Jadeja, he stays back and keeps it down

another run out on the cards, not a direct hit this time. Jadeja nudges the ball to leg and Siraj wants one so that Jadeja keeps strike for next over, he's sent back quickly and the midwicket fielder misses the stumps at the bowler's end
short, pulled and that's four! Useful runs for India but it means Siraj on strike against Starc in the next over
oh, he's ducked under it almost as soon as it's been delivered. Siraj sees the ball come out of the hand and ducks, and then has a smile for Cummins
makes room early this time, it's short again and he tries to get bat on it but misses
doesn't move much this time and ducks yet again under the bouncer

It's a length delivery that's close to the stumps, and it's actually been given out because Australia believe there was an edge. Wasn't much of an appeal there but he was given out almost immediately. India review and Snicko confirms there was an outside edge as Siraj tried to poke after backing away a bit
length on the pads and glanced to fine leg to get off the mark straightaway. Oh that came off the pad, so it's a leg bye. Warner not of the mark yet
length on a fifth stump line and moving away, left alone
moving away again outside off, and he shoulders arms again
good length on off, defended into the offside
this one nips back in from outside off, and Pucovski defends solidly

bouncer, and dealt with superbly by the debutant. Climbs on an offstump line but he gets into good position to pull this to deep midwicket with authority. The momentum of the swivel made him lose balance and fall down, but after the shot had been hit. There was no need to run anyway
on target, attacking the stumps and hitting a good length, defended from the crease
back of a length outside off, pushed into the offside
hurried him a bit, coming into him from a length and he jabs at it from the crease, keeping it out
fuller, defended back down the pitch

good bowling, after bringing them in, he jags this one away, going across Warner, who was coming forward to defend and can't stop his hands from a tiny movement following the ball. Movement is enough to elude the edge
fuller, tapped to mid-off
fuller on off, defended towards mid-on
length on the stumps, defended on the front foot
cracking shot. Too short outside off, doesn't really rise, so he has the room and length to essay a superb backfoot punch through cover
fuller on off, comes on the front foot to defend
length outside off, defended to cover
length, closer to off, bat close to body as he defends to cover
that one kept low. Length ball outside off, it's a brand new ball, should have been zipping through but it scoots at just above ankle height.
fuller outside off, driven to cover on the front foot
length, going across him, stays in his crease and punches to cover
fuller, going across him, lands outside off and going further away
rides the bounce nicely to punch through point. Shorter ball, outside off, Warner stays beside the ball and times it well
length on the stumps, he was on the back foot a bit, and almost fell over while clipping it through midwicket on the back foot
length ball coming in on off, pushes at it, gets a thick inside edge to square leg
full on the stumps, turned off his toes to fine leg
length outside off, Warner looks a bit tentative, because this one kept a mite low too. steers it towards the slips.
clipped to midwicket
length coming into him, ends up on the pads, tucked to square leg
sharp bouncer to end, Warner goes all Matrix in arching his back to let it pass over him
length on off stump, shuffles across from his guard outside leg to be in line with the ball to defend it
back of a length, goes to pull but that maybe another one that didn't bounce as expected. Goes under his bat and he cops it on the midriff
length on the stumps, closes the bat face while keeping it near his body to get  a couple through midwicket
fuller outside off, defended to cover

gets the outside edge. Superb ball, not much Pucovski could do. Banged in on a hard length and gets it to move appreciably away. Pucovski shaping to defend but the ball kisses the outside edge and Saha dives to his right to hold on.
full on the pads, and he turns it, using wrists, to get off the mark with a brace through midwicket
tired the yorker I think but missed it narrowly, which allowed Warner to on-drive beautifully, to the long-on fence
length outside off, punched to cover
back of a length outside off, cuts it forcefully but straight to cover
length on off, coming into him, defended
homing in on that off stump is Bumrah, but Warner's moving confidently now. On the front foot to defend solidly
shot. Gets a bit of margin and makes it count. A mite too full outside off and he's on that front foot to punch through cover
full on off, defended back. Siraj has a shy at the striker's end, except the ball is nowhere near the stumps. Saha jumps up to collect and prevent an embarrassing four overthrows
rocks back to this short ball and pulls with authority through square leg. Nicely transferred weight back and swivelled to generate power while also controlling it
length outside off, defended
length outside off, pushed into the offside
fuller on leg stump, flicked off his pads to square leg
angling in on off, fuller ball, defended
fullish, angling into him, tucked through midwicket
short ball outside off, thought about pulling but decided against it, so wafted the bat over the ball to ensure he wouldn't touch it
magnificent and disdainful. Bit of a gift, short and wide outside off, but he deals with it in a manner so pleasing to the eye. Stands tall and slaps it through cover with superb timing
length coming into him on off, defended towards mid-on
room outside off again, and on the shorter side, stays beside it and punches through point
full and wide outside off, he goes for the drive and connects smoothly. There is a sweeper back though, so he mops up
fuller, comes on the front foot to defend

he's trapped him lbw but Warner wants to review this, almost immediately. Was floated up on a length and going straight on, Warner went for the slog-sweep. The ball wasn't full enough for it, so he misses it entirely and is struck on the back leg. Hawkeye says umpire's call on impact, so Warner will have to be on his way. Ashwin has had the wood over him historically, and does it again.
goes back and whips this through midwicket
fuller, uses wrists to turn it through square leg, staying back in his crease
dances down the track and gets to the pitch to drive through mid-on
down the track again but almost beaten in flight. Had to adjust with the loop and drift and ended up pushing it into the legside
back of a length on off, defended down the pitch
length on off, stays on the back foot and whips to square leg
back of a length on off, clips it towards midwicket off the back foot
full on the pads, picked off his feet to square leg
beaten. Goes for the drive to a length ball that's nipping in outside off, and doesn't connect
length on the stumps, clipped to midwicket

muted appeal, but I think that's sliding down leg. Ashwin is convinced and he has convinced Rahane to take a review. This was tossed up on leg stump, Smith went for a hard slog-sweep and missed it, beaten by the loop, but the ball pitched and was turning into him. Surely sliding down. And after a delay with Hawkeye, we finally confirm that was missing leg stump. In fact it was just clipping, so India get to hang on to their review.
lovely bowling, nice loop on a length and turning  in from off, Smith defends
tossed up a bit fuller, and Smith pushes it gently. The fielder at mid-on who is almost beside the non-striker gathers
goes back to this and opens the face to half-edge and half-steer it through gully
length outside off, punched back to the bowler
turn for Ashwin. Marnus was making room to punch but it spins sharply into him and he ends up softly patting it towards silly point
back of a length outside off, straightens a touch, jabbed towards backward point. Got it higher on the bat, with the bounce a touch more than he expected
length ball defended back to the bowler
length on off, defended
low bounce again. Back of a length and Smith was looking to pull that into oblivion but the ball sneaks under bat to thud into his thigh pad
length on off, turned to backward square leg by closing the bat face. He's overstepped though, so that's a no-ball
fuller on off, defended to cover
length on off, turned to midwicket.
slow full toss at 84.6kmh, Labuschagne sweeps that away in the gap on the leg side for a four
too short and wide, he cuts and finds the fielder
turning in towards the stumps now, he goes back and tucks it to deep midwicket
shouts of 'catch it' as Smith also goes back and nudges the ball with the turn off the pads for one
more flight and closer to the stumps, he straight bats it towards mid on
short and wide for the second time this over and this time Labuschagne cuts it wide of point for three
targets the stumps with a good-length delivery, he defends it to leg
just short of gully! Outside off, Labuschagne pushes at it away from the body for a thick edge, Rahane dives to his left with both hands but it doesn't carry
closer to the stumps and this time it's steered to deep point
angling into the stumps for Smith, he goes across and works this wide of mid on
too short, Labuschagne gets on top of it with a pivot on the back foot and pulls it away with style for four behind square
short on off this time, he slices it to deep point and keeps strike again. Lead over 150 now
works this ball with the turn to the leg side for one
flighted around off at 85.5kmh, Smith leans into it and drives to long-on
beats him! Labuschagne lunges forward for the off break outside off, it turns a long way and hits him on the pad but was probably hitting him outside off
bit quicker and he defends it back
comes out of the crease, Ashwin slows it down and the batsman works it to leg for one
forward lean and blocked on the leg side
good length ball towards the stumps, Labuschagne defends it to leg
touch shorter and around off stump, he defends off the back foot
no movement, 132 kmh, he stays back and punches the ball to cover
on the pads this time, he flicks it away just behind square and beats the packed leg-side field for four
back to outside off, this time driven on the up a little bit to point
towards middle and leg, and flicked to square leg this time
goes across a bit and works the ball with the turn to leg
brings out the sweep and finds the fielder behind square on leg
Ashwin slows it down, Labuschagne waits and then defends it back
turning into him and this time he nudges it to deep midwicket for one
charges down the track, goes for a big swing and he drives that almost inside-out to the long-off boundary for four
tossed up from Ashwin outside off, he leans forward and pushes it down to long on
135kmh, targets the stumps from just outside off, he defends it to leg
slightly straighter around off stump, Smith goes across and defends it down the ground
on the pads, Smith nudges it to midwicket and decides against the single
slower one at 123kmh, it waits on Smith a bit before he drives it down to mid off
goes towards the pads this time and Smith helps it along to fine leg for two
Smith stays back and waits for the ball before defending it back
pushes this on the off side for a single
bit wide and short, it turns in and he punches it to mid off
comes forward this time and drives the fuller ball back to Ashwin
leans into the ball this time and flicks it to leg
wide outside off again, Smith goes back and punches that nicely in the gap on the off side for two
nicely tossed up on off at 79.6kmh, makes the batsman wait and he helps it to leg with the turn
this length ball keeps a bit low while heading towards off stump, Smith does well to defend it back
towards off stump again, Smith covers his stumps and pushes it to mid on
stays back in the crease again, and helps this along to midwicket
touch wider outside off, Smith defends off the back foot again
a little wider again and this time Smith pounces on it with a cover drive that's middled from the bat for the big gap in the covers
hint of extra bounce surprises Smith a bit outside off as he defends
too full, driven handsomely and Saini dives to his left at cover to save four
towards the pads now and it's helped along to leg for one
straighter this time around off, driven down the ground with a straight bat and this time Ashwin dives to his left from mid on to save a few
goes across and nudges the ball to fine leg for one more
bit straighter now and Labuschagne defends it down the ground
straight delivery on off, driven down the ground and Ashwin puts in another dive from mid on to save more runs
on the stumps at 134kmh, Smith covers the stumps and defends to mid on
beats him outside off! 135.5 kmh this time, just a touch wider outside off, Smith hangs his bat out and the ball holds its line to miss the outside edge
back to the off stump line and Smith pushes it down again
length delivery again on the stumps, Smith covers the line yet again and blocks it back
on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket by closing the face of the bat
keeps a little low as it head towards off, Smith offers the straight bat as usual
132kmh, beaten outside off. Siraj bowls it on length a bit outside off, Labuschagne pokes and misses
walks across a little bit this time and punches it down
touch fuller outside off and he drives it comfortably on off
a little too straight for Labuschagne who flicks with his wrist and Ashwin gives it a chase but they take three
just a bit of extra bounce again outside off, Smith taken by surprise while defending on off
moves the line to middle and leg stump, and Smith helps it to midwicket
133kmh, on length outside off and it's blocked easily
around middle and he works it to leg for one
136.1kmh, tight line and length outside off, he defends it on off
138kmh, pulls the length back a little bit, Smith stays back and defends with a straight bat
stays back again for the ball and defends with a dead bat
too full, hint of room, and Smith dispatches that to the cover boundary with an expansive cover drive
outside off on length this time, Smith defends easily
he aims for the stumps and it's worked to the leg side for one more
outside off, the big drive from Smith but he finds cover this time
nipping it in from outside off, goes on the back foot and blocks it
shuffles across to expose the leg stump, and clips the ball to leg
looked like an offcutter from outside off, Smith watches it carefully and blocks
fullish at 131kmh outside off, driven into the covers with hard hands
shuffles across and clips the ball past midwicket for two, might have been a misfield there, and Smith comes back
misses this one while trying to work the back of length ball to leg and is struck high on the pad
back of length outside off, he punches it into the covers
too full this time and driven to cover for a quick single
bangs this one in a little short, and Smith defends it down the ground
nips it in a little bit towards the stumps, Smith covers the stumps and blocks again
outside off and a rare delivery left alone
targets the stumps, Labuschagne covers the line and helps it to leg
Labuschagne plays a bit early this time while trying to flick the ball to leg, gets a thick outside edge back to Siraj
128.3kmh, this bowling is getting slower. Outside off again, and he defends it back again

around off, straight bat and defended to leg yet again
down the leg side fo a change and it goes past Smith's pads
goes for the off stump line, Smith blocks it away
back of length outside off, punched away to deep cover for one
on off and middle, Labuschagne keeps his head down and blocks
a little full, Labuschagne flicks it with a roll of his wrists and finds the gap despite a packed leg side field for his sixth four. On 46 now
goes for the yorker but it's a low full toss, and clipped to mid on for one
fuller around off, works it towards mid-on with the wrists

length ball around off, Smith shuffles and blocks

length ball around off, stays back and defended with a straight bat

length ball around off, blocked this time
length around off once again, stays back and punches it towards extra cover
nipping back in sharply from a length to catch Labuschagne by surprise, he does well though to glance it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards mid-on
length ball outside off, Labuschagne pushes at it and gets beaten
fifty for Labuschagne. Fuller around off, punches it towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball around off, closes the face of the bat to turn it towards square leg

fuller around off, keeps a touch low. Smith was stuck in the crease but does well to bring his bat down in time
fuller around off, comes on the front foot and defends it under his eyes

a touch shorter this time, defended from the back foot
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg for a single
fuller around off, stays in the crease and defends
length ball around off, Smith is behind it and blocks again

length ball around off, stays in the crease and offers another block
length ball, just outside off, defended towards mid-on
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball angling in, stays in his crease and blocks
length ball outside off, pushes it towards extra cover and sets off for a quick single
too full outside off and driven past the bowler, a desperate dive from Siraj doesn't help and the ball beats the mid-off for four
length ball around off, a bit of shuffle and defended
a short one outside off, looks to pull initially before deciding to duck
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards backward square leg
flatter around off, stays back and defends
length ball around off, some turn there. works it towards short midwicket
flatter outside off, 91.8kph. Goes for the paddle sweep and misses. Gets hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but the impact was outside off
flighted around off, comes forward and pushes it on the leg side
tossed up outside off, looks to poke at it. Gets a thick outside edge into the ground. Dribbles past Rahane at slip
length ball around off, stays on the crease and defends

length ball spinning on to the pads, turns it towards square leg
uses his feet and pushes it towards mid-on, all along the ground
length ball on the pads once again, another single to square leg
tossed up around off, uses his feet and lofts it through the gap between the bowler and the mid-off
lunges forward and defends this flighted delivery

a shimmy down the ground to defend this leg-stump delivery

95.9kph, flatter around off, Labuschagne thrusts his bat at it
pulls out the reverse sweep and hits it hard behind point for four, 100 of the stand also comes up

fuller around off and middle, defended on the leg side
fuller again, punched towards mid-off this time
another overpitched delivery, driven through extra cover this time, off the mark with a boundary

a thick outside edge as this one keeps straight. Smith was stuck on the back foot as well. A single past slip
fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover

length but well outside off once again, shouldered arms
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks

back of a length on a fourth stump line, punched to cover

magnificent. Read the length early so was in position to punch this regally through cover. Didn't move feet, didn't have to, with room outside off and the ball short enough, and his eye ensuring he was perfectly balanced when meeting the ball
back of a length on off, defended back to the bowler
too full on the pads, easily flicked through midwicket. There is a man on the boundary, so it's just one

he's poked it through to the keeper. Squared him up with the angle coming into him and the ball straightening a touch, got extra bounce too and Wade follows this back of length ball outside off with his hands. Tried to pull away but wasn't quick enough and feathers an edge for a straightforward catch to Saha. Some cheer for Saini now, in what has been a tough initiation to Test cricket
fuller on the stumps, patted back gently
length outside off angling into him, solidly defended towards cover

oh that's just sublime from Smith. A rare bad ball from Bumrah, too full outside off, and Smith's batting in his bubble where a bad ball is a bad ball and needs to be put away in style. Hands through the ball as he strokes it through cover
kept a touch low that one, length on off, but he was nicely behind it and defended
length on off, moving across as always is Smith and he blocks it
good length on the fourth stump, steered towards gully
leading edge falls short of point. Length ball tailing into him, Green wants to flick it away but closes the bat early and gets a leading edge
length on the stumps, pushed towards cover
fuller on a sixth stump line, he covers the line and shoulders arms
length ball slanting into him, moves inside the line to tuck it off thigh pad through backward square leg
good length on off, moves across to tap it towards midwicket

spat up off a length. That uneven bounce is going to be a handful as the game enters it's final stretch. This was on a length on off, and Smith had to get his hands up in a hurry to fend it down. Gets hit on the splice and has to take his bottom hand off the bat
length outside off, left alone
past the outside edge. Coming in with the angle on a length, and Green pushes at it inside the line, the ball whizzes past the edge
length on the stumps, tapped into the legside
length outside off, confidently on the front foot to block it

edged past the lone slip. There is only one slip, standing wider than the normal first slip, Pujara there, but this was away from his outstretched diving hands to his right. Green pushed hard at a length ball in the channel and got the edge
length on off, pushed to point

popped in the air but didn't carry to Gill at backward square leg. Back of a length and Smith was pushing at it with hands in front of body, got it off the inside edge and it popped up in the air, but fell short of a diving Gill
length on leg stump, tucked backward of square
length, coming into him on off, tapped into the offside
fuller on off, comes on the front foot to push, gets a thick inside edge. Gill at backward square leg in action again, dives to his left to stop the ball
length on the stumps, patted back down the pitch
too full and Green will get some confidence from that shot. Came nicely forward to drive through cover. Hung in the air for a mite, but in the gap and timed well enough to go all the way
bouncer outside off, Smith in perfect control as he swivels to pull this to deep square leg and raise fifty. He's well and truly back
length on the stumps, gets behind it to defend

they get an overthrow. Length on off, pushed towards cover and Green was setting off for a run that wasn't there. Sent back by Smith when he had gone almost halfway, the fielder has a shy that misses, so they get the run anyway
another short ball outside off, another authoritative pull shot from Smith. Makes good connection, to deep midwicket this time. There's a fielder back there though
length on leg stump, tries to flick it away but can't get enough bat on it, the ball just plops down near the short leg area
fuller on off, defended
full on off stump, tapped towards cover
fuller on the stumps, blocked back towards the bowler
length on off, defended from the crease
back of a length on off, Smith happy to keep defending those
length on off, pushed back gently towards the bowler
back of a length coming into him, tapped into the legside

tossed up a bit more, still attacking the stumps, defended again

length outside off, punched back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, defended
flatter, he's stepping out to it, manages to whip it off pad through midwicket
back of a length on the stumps, moves across to tap it towards mid-on
length on off, pushed back towards the bowler

back of a length outside off, rising up appreciably, he's coming on the front foot but has to adjust and defend it down towards gully
length outside off, defended to the bowler's right
length on middle and leg, turned to backward square leg
tossed up on the stumps, comes on the front foot to work it to midwicket
flatter, fired in quicker, Smith was skipping down the track, thumps it to midwicket but Rohit dives to his right to pull off a good save
tossed up nicely on off, dipping on him, comes on the front foot and plays it back to the bowler with bat in front of pad
makes room to cut, but that's not short enough and he gets an under-edge that chops down on the ground
goes back and glances this fine, placed well enough to get two with the fielder who is back having to make ground to his right
length on off, stands tall and punches to mid-on
nipping into him from back of a length outside off, but Green has been very sure in his defending from the crease
fuller, tailing into him a bit, comes on the front foot and drives to mid-off
fuller, ends up on the pads, clipped to mid-on. Green is looking for the single but sent back, which prompts the fielder to have a shy. Gathered by Saha
length sliding down leg, moves inside the line and flicks it off his pads to deep square leg
thick edge bounces to gully. Length outside off, he was coming on the front foot to punch

room outside off so he clears his front leg and glides it through backward point

fuller, outside leg, Smith goes to paddle-sweep it fine, but there is a short fine leg who stops it

fuller, pushed to mid-off. He's looking for a single again, but there isn't one. Vihari at mid-off throws to the keeper, but the ball hits Green in the leg while he's turning back. Hand raised in apology from the fielder
turn for Ashwin, as he pitches slightly short of a length on off, and Saha gathers it outside leg. Smith was looking to swat it away, missed
length outside off, cuts it to deep point

length ball in the channel. A thick outside edge into the ground and to Rahane's left at gully. Good stop

carrom ball, like a leggie from around the wicket. Goes off the pad to short leg, as he misses the flick
pushes at it outside leg and gets a thick edge that rolls towards backward point
another carrom ball, or was it just a proper leg-break? Tapped towards short fine leg
got a glove on it and it goes very fine. Ashwin still bowling leg-spinners, targetting the rough outside leg stump? But it's well down leg and he sweeps hard, gets enough contact for a boundary
tapped to midwicket

shaping away from him on a fifth stump line, he's drawn into poking at it, goes past the outside edge
swinging into him now, and he misses the flick as he moves across.
and again, moves it away. But this is a bit too far outside off, so easily left alone
just past gully. Fuller on the fifth stump again, moving away, and he goes hard at it. Gets a healthy edge and gully can't reach it despite diving to his right. That's a maiden Test fifty for Green
inswinger, but down leg. Saha gathers
length, but well outside off, left alone
too much room outside off and that is stroked to deep point
flowing drive to one that is on a sixth stump line, confidently on the front foot and leans into it. Rohit at cover dives to his left to stop it
thwack. Disdainfully done. Dances down the track to a fast bowler with a second new ball, makes room and wallops him over deep midwicket with a clean, baseball swing of the bat
back of a length well outside off, moves across and glides it through backward point
walking across and this one is slipped wide of leg stump, so he can't reach it. An ODI wide

gone through him. Zips  past the outside edge even as he's looking to drive. Missed the outside edge by a centimetre

full outside off, bends his back leg and punches through cover with excellent timing

doesn't time it as well but still gets it over long-on! This was not as full as the previous one, more bottom hand in this as he doesn't get fully underneath. Goes flatter than the last ball but still sails over long-on.
short outside off, cuts off the back foot to deep point
bouncer on the stumps, ducks under it
length outside off, Saha collected it in front of his face. Good carry with the new ball. The batsman was poking at it, luckily for him, doesn't catch the edge
what a shot. Stunning execution by Green. This is almost a yorker on the stumps, he's gone on the back foot, cleared his front leg and drilled it straight past the bowler

take that says Green. If you bounce me, I'll send you over the fence. And not just that, I'll do it on the front foot to a ball that's homing in on my head. Bumrah banged it in hard and it was rising, but Green hooks it on the front foot over square leg.

and now the length ball, nipping in, Green stepping away to thrash it again, but is beaten. Or is he? Saha's gone up in spontaneous appeal and the umpire has given it. Green takes a pause and then reviews. There is a spike as the ball passes bat, and it does look like it took a feather of an inside edge, so Green's entertaining knock ends. Bumrah has some reward at last, having bowled his heart out.
