looks to drive at this fuller delivery, an outside edge into the ground and past the gully fielder
length ball around off, stays back and defends
length ball around off, Gill was on the back foot but manages to get his bat down
fuller outside off, looks to drive without actually being to the pitch of the ball, inside edge past the stumps
length ball around off, stays back and flicks it towards square leg at the very last moment
fuller and wider, drives away from the body. Gets it past backward point from the outer half of the bat
short of length angling across, gets on his toes and dabs it through cover and point
length ball on the pads, tucked away behind square leg
fuller and wider in the channel, left alone
length down the leg side, too far away from Gill to connect the glance
short but doesn't rise as much as Gill expected. He was looking to leave before realising he can pull it down and does so. A single to fine leg
fuller around off and middle, defended on the front foot
short and pulled down solidly but only a single to deep square leg
length ball in the corridor, left alone
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, on his toes off the back foot and blocked
length ball in the corridor, left alone
short of length around off, gets back it and defends
length ball outside off, defended square of the wicket
fuller around off, comes forward and offers solid defence
length ball around off, stays back and defends it towards cover
length outside off and Gill brings out his half-punch half-drive, sends it through the vacant extra cover region
length ball on the stumps, stayed down a bit, defended on the leg side
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it back

trapped in front. Rohit wants to review this after a brief chat with Gill. Length ball outside off, jags back in to beat the bat and hit Rohit just above the knee roll. Nothing on the HotSpot. Snicko is silent as well. The only thing that can save Rohit here is the height and surprisingly, it would have missed the stumps by a big margin. Rohit survives
almost chopped on. Short of length outside off, goes for the pull but gets an inside edge past the leg stump

another appeal, for caught behind. Hazlewood is almost pleading by the end of it. Gill has a smile on his face as Australia opt to review. Replays show it hit the top of the pad. No chance of lbw either as it's going way over. Was a length ball around off that came back in to cut Gill in half
fuller around off, a big forward stride and drives it towards extra cover
short of length on the stumps, pulls it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around fourth stumps, defended from the crease
fuller on the stumps, clipped towards deep square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends
fuller around off, a bit of shape away. Rohit comes forward and blocks
length ball, just around fourth stump, Rohit comes forward to defend and gets beaten as the ball moves away
length but way down the leg side and going further away from Gill as he tries to get some bat on it
fuller around off, comes forward and defends with bat and pad close
length ball but way down the leg side once again
length ball on the stumps, looks to flick but misses. Gets hit high on the pads but was going down
length ball on the pads, glanced to fine leg
fuller on the pads once again, flicked towards deep square leg, fielder there
length ball around off, defended
peach. Length ball around fourth stump. Looks to defend and gets beaten as it moves away
fuller around off, comes forward to defend. Gets a thick outside edge into the ground towards gully
length ball around off, stays back and defends
fuller around off, flicked but cannot beat short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, clipped to the right of midwicket
tossed up around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and turns it towards short leg
fuller around off, comes forward and works it towards short midwicket with soft hands
fuller around off, driven towards long-on
length ball spinning in from outside off, goes back and flicks it in front of square leg
length ball around off, transfers the weight forward and blocks
fuller around off, pushes it towards midwicket with short forward stride
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards mid-on
140.6kph. beats the bat. A length ball around off, forcing Gill to play at it. Not much feet movement as he looks to defend but the ball nips away sharply to beat the outside edge
drifting on to the pads this time and Gill flicks it to fine leg for four
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks

an outside edge past first slip. Length outside off, Gill was stuck on the crease once again, just hangs his bat out, gets an edge that goes through slip and gully. There is no second slip, it may have just carried to the man there
tossed up outside off, defended on the front foot
a touch fuller and straighter, turned away towards short midwicket
uses his feet and defends
tossed up outside off, defended on the front foot
walks down the wicket and hits it towards long-on. Was in the air for a while but away from any fielder
91.7kph, flatter around off, stays back and defends
length ball around off, a hint of movement away, defended
beauty! Fuller and pitching around off as it comes in with the angle, Rohit goes for the push but is beaten as the ball swings away
length ball around off, defended
another play and a miss. A length ball around off, Rohit comes forward to defend and gets beaten as it moves away from him
short of length outside off, pushed towards gully region
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
wide of the crease, fuller and angling on to the pads, flicked towards square leg
length ball angling in, tucked away on the leg side
length ball on the pads, glanced towards fine leg
length ball in the channel, left alone
length ball in the channel, shouldered arms once again
fuller around off, stays in the crease and blocks it
fuller around off, comes forward and smothers it
length ball around off, flicks it towards short midwicket

short of length outside off, goes for the Natraj pull, but misses. Gets hit on the pad and it dribbles towards slips. An appeal for lbw but it the impact was well outside off. Rohit is casual in getting back, Smith is aware of this and hits the stumps direct. They are checking upstairs for the run out but Rohit had just retreated before the ball hit the stumps
length ball on the stumps, defended
creamed through covers. Fuller around off, Rohit gets his front foot down and opens the face of the bat at impact to hit it squarer
length ball around off, taps it towards cover-point
full on the stumps, defended
angling into him from wide of the crease around the stumps, defended from the crease
speared in fuller on the stumps, jams his bat down in defence. Ball goes off the inside half into the legside
that angle is working for Starc, combined with his speed. Cramps Gill up as he's looking to defend, gets a thick inside edge onto pad
Gill moves a touch across to play that, and it's a length ball coming into him so he's able to clip it past midwicket
full, almost yorker length outside off, Rohit defends it down the pitch with a straight bat
starts off with a short ball outside off, not at full pace, and Gill controls his pull shot to deep square leg. Had to fetch it from over his right shoulder but did it well
back of a length outside off, punched to point
length outside off, defended to the bowler's left
fuller on the stumps, clipped off his toes to mid-on
fuller on the stumps, jammed to midwicket
smack He's swatted that pull shot to the long-on boundary. Opens up his stance when he sees it short and short-arm pulls it powerfully. Beats mid-on and goes to the fence, all along the ground

the languid grace of Rohit Sharma. Starc sticking to his round the wicket line, overpitches and Rohit leans into the most pleasing of cover drives. Teases the fielder inside the circle who's running after it, but just about beats him to the fence
full on the stumps, defended

oh that's just lovely. Technically, there's an argument for leaving that ball alone but why do it when you can pull off this gorgeous a shot. Full and on a sixth stump line, Rohit stretches out and leans into a textbook cover drive.
length angling into him, defended into the offside
length outside off, opens the face to steer to backward point
another full ball and another Rohit Sharma drive into the offside. This one is through mid-off and is more of a gentle push, but he'll still get three runs for it
length on middle and leg, tucked towards square leg
too far down legside, very full, Rohit can't get anywhere near that. Paine has to dive full length to his left to save it
length ball nipping into him, misses the flick and the ball rolls into the offside from the thigh pad
disdainful. After the easy drives the last over, Rohit brings out the pull shot now. Short on off, and he transfers weight back and pulls powerfully, over square leg
length ball, nipping in, misses the tuck and is struck on the pads. Half an appeal but that was clearly going down
length on the stumps, defended solidly
fuller outside off, front foot out to defend
tossed up outside off, comes on the front foot and the ball lobs to backward short leg off the pad. Wade dives and catches it. Half appeals but I think everyone knew that was pad, not bat
goes back and whips this length ball to midwicket
length ball, tapped to midwicket
stays in his crease to this length ball spinning into him and plays it down towards short leg
down the track, gets to the pitch and clips it to long-on.

loud and sustained appeal for caught behind and the umpire gives it. Gill reviews immediately. Good bowling, in the channel and drawing the poke. There is a mark on hotspot and a visible deviation too, so Gill will have to go. Bowled from slightly wide of the crease, pitches on off and straightens a touch. Did just enough to kiss the outside edge.
length ball nipping into him, defended to mid-on
thick inside edge flies off but falls short of square leg. Speared into him, he's stabbed at it, gets the inside edge that lands safe

he's got him lbw and Pujara almost indignantly reviews it immediately. Was it too high? or does Pujara think he had an inside edge on that? Length ball just outside off and coming in. No edge on hotspot or snicko. It's hitting him on the thigh pad and it's bouncing over the stumps. No wonder Pujara reviewed so quickly. He knew it had hit him too high
length outside off, defended with trademark Pujara soft hands into the offside
full on the pads, clipped to midwicket
tossed up, defended on the front foot
fuller outside off, fetches the paddle sweep and pats it nicely but there is a short fine leg there to cut it off
length outside off spinning into him, punched to midwicket
down the track comes Rohit and defends solidly on the front foot
length ball spinning into him from outside off, goes back and plays with the turn to short fine leg
nice loop, but Rohit does well to get a big front foot stride out and defend it, even though he wasn't quite at the pitch of that
length ball coming into him, defended on off stump
back of a length outside off, punched into the offside
length angled into him on off, defended into the legside
back of a length, fifth stump line, left alone
fuller on the stumps, solidly behind it to defend to mid-on
back of a length on off, defended, goes off the inside half of the bat into the legside
tossed up outside off, defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, comes on the front foot and drives through cover. Nice twirl of the wrists to ease that ball through
down the track, gets to the pitch and drives fluently through cover to find the boundary and get off the mark.
on the front foot to steer this towards point, but Lyon's extra bounce almost has him in trouble. That flies off the splice, but safely
fuller, comes on the front foot to clip to long-on from outside off
comes down the track again, wears it on the knee roll and it lobs up to Wade at short leg
fuller on off, defended back to the bowler. Hazlewood gathers and makes as if to have a shy at the stumps, then stares at the batsman
bangs it in short and on target outside off, climbing steeply. Rohit thinks about the pull but drops hands down in time. Good decision to let it go
too full on the pads, and flicked through midwicket
full outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, defended
mistimes his pull. Short ball climbing on him, and he is a bit late to pull, and the ball plops down near enough and short enough from midwicket
tossed up, comes down the track and dead-bats it
tossed up outside off, stays in his crease and defends to the legside
length on off, stays rooted to his crease and defends
down the track again but Lyon bowled this flatter, so he couldnt quite get to the pitch, ends up defending it from high on the bat but it drops down before silly mid-off can dive to it
uses his strong wrists to whip this through midwicket. Long chase for the fielder but is pulled in before the boundary
fuller on the stumps, flicked off his pads to deep square leg
length outside off, defended off the inside half of the bat
fuller on off, defended towards midwicket
fuller, punched back
length on off, squirted away into the offside
fuller on off, and he unfurls a crisp punch, but can't beat cover
length ball on the stumps, clipped off his pads to square leg's left
length outside off, punched to cover
fuller on the pads, turned to backward square leg, using wrists
fuller on the stumps, comes on the front foot to work it to midwicket

and he's reached fifty with an audacious whip to midwicket. Came down the track, it wasn't a bad ball, but he got to the pitch and used his wrists to flick aerially. There was a man at long-on so a mishit could have had him in trouble, but he places it perfectly
steered to backward point on the front foot and they get the single after a slight hesitation
length outside off, punched to mid-on
length on the stumps, defended

he's been caught at backward square leg. Rohit will be filthy with himself for that dismissal. Not perfectly directed short ball from Cummins, but he's bowled enough great ones to have earned that wicket. Rohit takes him on with the pull, connects too well perhaps and Starc's waiting at the boundary, holds on safely.
length on middle and off off, straightens, defended
length outside off, steered towards gully
back of a length on the stumps, goes inside the line and taps it down to fine leg
close call Banged in short again and it rises up sharply at Pujara, who is surprised by the bounce and a bit late in rising up with it to fend it down. Flies into the square leg area, but falls safe
tossed up outside off, defended on the front foot
a bit too short, goes back and whips it off his pads to square leg's right
sharp turn into him from outside off. He's not able to get bat on it, gets it on the thigh pad
fuller, comes on the front foot to get to the pitch and smothers it
sharp turn again from a length, pitches on a seventh stump line and ends up hitting him on the front thigh pad
he comes down the track, possibly to mess with the length and turn, and pads it away through the silly point area
length outside off, comes on the front foot to defend, inside edged onto pad. He's over-stepped, so it's a no-ball
length on off, kept a tad low, defended from the crease
back of a length outside off, rises up with the ball on his toes and steers it through backward point
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
short ball, but not rising enough and Rahane keeps his pull shot controlled and along the ground to deep square leg
and there's the danger ball. Angled in and jags away after pitching. Leg-cutter bowled with precision and without losing pace
length on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
fuller outside off, lets it through
tossed up on off, comes on the front foot and defends
tossed up outside off, he lunges on the front foot to defend
flatter and quicker on a length he jabs it away
going more round arm I think is Lyon. flat on the stumps, defended from the crease
length ball on the stumps, Rahane calmly pats it back
Right on the money first up, homing in around off stump, but Pujara defends solidly into the offside
full on off, tapped to mid-on

pinged on his left shoulder. Back of a length ball rising up to near his ribs, Pujara thought it was going higher and was ducking. Excellent ducking technique, dropped his hands and was turning his body, so the ball hits him on the left shoulder when it doesn't rise as expected. No expression from Pujara
length on off, he's played this on the back foot through square leg. The short leg fielder dived to his right with the ball in the air, but that would have been a miracle catch
back of length outside off, pushed to point
back of a length on off, punched to cover
tossed up outside off, and Pujara is nimbly down the track, gets to the pitch and drives along the ground. Can't beat a tumbling extra cover though, so no run
and this time he finds the gap on the legside. Down the track again and uses his wrists to twirl it through midwicket. Long chase for the fielder so they get three
length outside off, spinning in a fair bit, Rahane goes right back and flicks it off his pads

got him at short leg. Australia have their early breakthrough and it's a big one. Rahane was coming on the front foot to defend, Lyon bowled this on the perfect length so that Rahane couldn't get to the pitch even with a full stretch. Pitches outside off, turns enough to just get the inside edge and flies straight to short leg, who holds on.
fuller outside off, defended on the front foot
tossed up on the stumps and gets some nice drift into him, but it's full enough for Pant to come on the front foot and defend

and again Cummins just seems to wake up and be able to hit a perfect line and length. Just outside off and gets it to move away too, Pujara's holding bat close to body so it goes past the outside edge
banged in short and it's rising over leg stump, Pujara ducks safely underneath
lovely shot. A rare ball that's overpitched from Cummins on off, and he leans into the off-drive. Impeccable timing from Pujara, beats mid-off and gets four
fuller outside off, moves a bit inwards, but Pujara has his off stump covered and lets it go safely
back of a length outside off, opens the face to steer through backward point
length outside off, comes confidently on the front foot to steer it through point with an open bat face
Pujara down the track again, gets to the pitch and turns it to midwicket
tossed up outside off, Pujara thrusts his front pad out and the ball lobs up off the knee roll. Silly mid-off goes to his right and catches.
quicker one, goes right back and defends on off stump
and Pujara again thrusting that front pad forward - he's doing that when he judges he can't get to the pitch - outside off and it rolls to fine leg
tapped to mid-on on the front foot
down the track again and covers the line of the ball outside off, pushes it with a defensive shot, bounces to silly mid-off
good length targetting off stump, Pant stays still and steers it towards point
full and quick on off, Pant defends from the crease, getting behind it
angling into him, tucked to midwicket
there's the short ball - I expected one a bit earlier to Pant actually - but it's too short and he ducks under easily

another short ball, outside off and Pant decides to go for the shot, but he doesn't go hard. Had to fetch it from over his left shoulder, ended up just sort of lobbing it into the legside. Square leg is back at the boundary so it lands safely. Might have winced a bit while playing that shot too, perhaps that elbow is hurting him
nicely behind it to defend to mid-on

was that a thin edge? Not such a thin one actually. Nice loop outside off and Pant gets the edge going forward to defend. Paine can't hold on to that will go down as a dropped chance. Got the bottom of his gloves
fuller on off, defended
fuller outside off, bit of bounce for Lyon but easy enough to leave for Pant
length on off, defends with a straight bat into the offside
length outside off, makes room and goes back to cut it, but can't beat point
tossed up on off, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the channel, left alone
pops up in the air but drops well in front of short leg, just beside Pujara. Length ball, moving away, he's gone to defend, gets an inside edge onto thigh pad
fuller outside off, left alone
short ball, but well down legside, so he has to just stay still and let it pass through
fuller on off, defended towards point
fuller outside off and that one scooted through low to Paine. Left alone by Pujara
length on off, defended from the crease
tossed up fuller, comes on the front foot to drive to cover
length outside off, punched to point
closer to off stump and fuller, stays in his crease and pushes it back to the bowler
flatter on off, punched back down the pitch
slightly back of a length and more room outside off, he stays on the back foot and cuts it hard to point
back of a length angling into him, taps it through midwicket on the back foot
good length on off, defended
bouncer outside off, but banged in short enough that he can arch his back and let it sail over
full outside off, and Pujara drives past mid-off again. Didn't time it perfectly but once that beat mid-off there are runs on offer
bouncer on target, and Pant has to duck under in a hurry as it goes over off
back of a length outside off, and Pant flicks it to mid-on
skips down the track again, pats it into the offside. Silly mid-off fields
stays in his crease then, and defends with a straight bat.
was looking to step down but sees the length early and doesn't advance, and defends outside off
goes right back to this one and turns it into the legside

tossed up outside off and Pujara wears it on his pad, well outside off. There is an appeal but that might not have turned enough to be threatening the stumps. In fact, replays show that was umpire's call on hitting the stumps. Paine and Lyon had a chat about reviewing but decided against it. Wouldn't have lost the review if they had gone for it
defended from the crease
length on the stumps, defended
back of a length into him, goes to defend, bounces a bit more and takes the shoulder of the bat. Edge drops well short of gully who does well to dive to his right and field
great fielding by Wade at cover. Back of a length outside off and Pant punches this very crisply indeed, but Wade dives to his right and stops it one-handed
bouncer outside off, Pant drops his hands and sways out of the way
fuller on the pads, clipped to mid-on
full on off, defended solidly on the front foot
down the track again, gets to the pitch and taps it to mid-on
length outside off, stays beside it and steers to point. Calls Pant through for a well-judged single
tossed up on middle and leg, defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, going straight on, Pant lets it go
tossed up on off, makes him lunge forward to get to the pitch, he does and punches it to short cover
tossed up on the stumps, turned gently to midwicket
length outside off, tapped gently to cover
length outside off, defended to point
length outside off, tapped to point
length on off, coming into him, defended from the crease
bouncer on off, a bit too short and goes well over him
fuller coming into him on off, defended calmly on the front foot
beaten. Plays on Pant's patience, with a full wide one outside off and draws him into the drive, but the ball beats him
flicked through midwicket to pick up a couple
good length drifting into him, defended on the front foot
down the track and over the in-field. Lyon has long-off back and mid-on in the circle so Pant gets to the pitch and lifts it against the turn, over mid-on
and even better now. Gets to the pitch again and a clean swing through the ball carries it well over the boundary. Wouldn't have mattered if a long-on was there
tossed up outside off, and he has to stretch out to drive it, manages to get enough punch on it to beat cover

fuller on off, defended to cover on the front foot and they take the quick single. Would have been safe even with a direct hit, but you've got to wonder about the advisability of quick singles at this time
full on the pads, flicked away but straight to midwicket
full, swinging into him on off, but he's solid in defence
digs it in short but it's mis-directed well down legside
length ball outside off, nipping back in, left alone. Fair bit of carry on that one, off a length
length ball coming back into him but tagetting off that time, Pujara gets bat on it, as it plops down
length outside off, spinning awa, left alone
fuller outside off, defended into the offside
too much room outside off and too short, Pant stands in his crease and thrashes it through cover. Pant has made Lyon think about his lengths due to that last over
this time he goes straight back. Down the pitch, doesn't get fully to the pitch but the placement is right. He got it off the toe end almost but over the bowler's head and into the straight boundary
length outside off, cuts it to point
nice length tossed up on off, comes on the front foot to defend
full on off, defended on the front foot
in the air for a brief bit, but safe. Well directed short ball, rising up to his ribs even as Pujara's rising on his toes, manages to fend it down and short leg can't quite reach it
back of a length defended

back of a length in the channel, Pujara is generally so good at not following the ball with his hands but is drawn into poking at that one. Hazlewood has been bringing the ball in, perhaps that's why Pujara went for it. Beaten on the outside edge with one that holds its line
and this one nips in again, on off, Pujara defends it, gets it on the inside half of the bat to drop down
angling into him and tucked to backward square leg
down the track and he goes for the drive, inside edges onto pad and the ball trickles towards point. They rush through for a quick single. But Marnus has overstepped so it's a no-ball
tossed up on the stumps, defended
length outside off spinning away, left alone
length outside off, stays legside of it and cuts to point
length on the stumps, gets some turn away, defended back down the pitch
length on off, and spinning away, chopped towards cover
tossed up too much and Pujara down the track, slams this full toss back down the ground and to the long-on boundary
edged and just wide of the lone slip. Full outside off and he drives well away from his body. Steve Smith at first slip dives full stretch to his left but the ball's gone past him
fuller on the stumps, defended back to the bowler. He's overstepped though, so another no-ball
full outside off, driven to cover on the front foot

short ball but doesn't rise enough and Pant swivels to pull this from chest height to deep midwicket. Pucovski at deep square leg sprints to his right and manages to pull the ball in before the ropes. 50-run partnership between these two
fullish around off, defended
short ball on a sixth stump line, Pujara merely watches it go through
length on off, solidly on the front foot to defend
length ball spinning in from around the wicket, helped towards square leg
length but way outside off, Pujara leaves that alone
works this to the right of mid-off for a quick single
a low full toss around off, swiped towards short midwicket
use of feet to take it on the full, hits it hard towards mid-off
fuller around off, pushes it towards mid-on
flatter and fuller around off, defended from the crease
tossed up slightly, comes forward and blocks
uses his feet this time but Lyon shortens his length, pushed back
length ball around off, stands in his crease and punches this towards cover
length around off, punched towards cover off the back foot
walks towards the bowler and nudges it back to him
starts with a length ball but it's way down the leg side. Pujara is not interested
short and rising towards the rib cage, dabs it down towards backward square leg
length ball outside off, came slower off the wicket, pushed towards cover-point
short this time, rising steeply but the line is once again down the leg side. Pujara stays away from it
length but way down the leg side. Pujara won't mind that as he ignores this
short of length outside off, left alone
down the ground, reaches to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over wide long-off, going inside out for a six
long-on is in place but Pant backs himself to clear him. And does it comfortably. Use of feet once again and powers it with the bottom hand for back-to-back sixes
that's fifty for Pant. Short of length outside off, rocks back and cuts it to sweeper cover
tossed up around off, a couple of small steps down the ground to smother it
length ball spinning in, goes deep and defends
length ball around off, defended towards mid-on with a straight bat
short of length around off, Pant arches back and slaps it behind point. Pucovski with the chase but cannot stop the boundary
short of length around off, hops and defends it down
an attempted bouncer, swivels and manages to pull it down, it hurried on to him
short of length aimed at the ribs. Gets on the top of the bounce and drops it down on the leg side
an attempted bouncer, doesn't rise much but once again the line is down the leg side. Left alone by Pujara
short of length around off, rises on his toes and dabs it towards point
starts with a bouncer but it's angling down the leg side, Pant leaves it alone
fuller around off, Pant was late to come forward but defends solidly nonetheless
length ball angling in, defended on the leg side
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards midwicket
a loopy bouncer, Pujara has no trouble ducking under that one. Paine collects it around waist
length ball around off, gets behind it and blocks

dropped again by Paine. Fuller outside off and spinning away. Pant with little footwork thrusts his hands at it and gets a healthy outside edge. Paine once again was quick to get up, it hits his gloves and goes down
uses his feet to pad it away
length ball on middle and leg, turned towards short midwicket
length ball outside off, punched towards point from the back foot
length ball spinning in, defended from the back foot
comes down the track and pads away this length ball. An appeal for bat-pad but denied. There was no bat involved
short of length at the body, tucked away towards deep square leg
a bouncer angling in at the batsman. Pujara ducks under
short of length around off, defended on the off side
length ball coming in towards the off stump, Pujara is watchful and defends it under his eyes
short of length angling in on to the pads, flicked away towards square leg, and they comes back for the second
short of length around off, stays back, on his toes and defended
fuller around off, punched to the right of Lyon who dives across to prevent any runs
fuller again, a touch wider, pushes it towards cover-point for a quick single
length ball around off and spinning across sharply, worked towards short fine leg
uses his feet but gets too close to the ball. Pushes it towards mid-on
length ball at the stumps, Pujara was looking to give himself some room. Pushes it towards covers
uses of feet once again to this length ball before defending
fuller and wider and creamed through extra cover, leans into the drive. Also, Starc has overstepped
length ball on the stumps, whipped towards deep square leg
length ball around off, stays back and drops it on the off side. Was looking for a single but Pant says no
short of length outside off, steers it behind point, Lyon with the chase and a sliding stop to keep it to two
fuller this time, angling on to the pads, Pujara helps it to fine leg
fuller and wider outside off, driven but Pucovski dives full length to his left at point to make the stop
short this time, Pant transfers the weight back and pulls it in front of square, four more to deep midwicket
uses his feet and pushes it towards mid-on
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards backward square leg
fuller around off, lunged forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and defends it late

a big, big appeal for lbw but the umpire is unmoved. Paine is having a chat with Lyon but they decide very early not to review this. Was a length ball spinning in, Pujara went for the flick but missed and was hit on the pad in front of middle and leg. Probably would have gone down
length ball spinning in towards middle and leg, defended on the leg side
length ball in the channel, left alone
length ball nipping in, Pant comes forward and blocks. An inside edge on to the pads
length ball outside off, stays in the crease and pushes it towards point
short of length, kicks off at the batsman, Pant fends at it and is lucky that it goes down towards gully. Looked like it hit him on the glove
great response. Cummins goes for fuller delivery but Pant just punches it through extra cover, mid-off put in the chase but in vain
length ball at the stumps, defended
falls short of first slip. Fuller around off, Pujara was looking to defend but soft hands and the late adjustment of opening the face of the bat save him
uses his feet and pushes it towards covers
an inside edge this time, on to the pads but goes behind short leg
whips it on the leg side but short leg comes in the way. Pujara was quick to retreat in his crease
stays deep this time and defends it with a straight bat
uses his feet to whip it towards deep square leg
fuller on the stumps, driven back firmly but Cummins stops it in his followthrough
short of length around off, gets on his toes and defends it down
length ball around off, comes forward and defends under his eyes
a touch fuller outside off, Pujara plays late and defends
short ball outside off, Pujara sways away
length ball outside off, defended square of the wicket
fuller around off, lunged forward and blocks
length ball outside off, turn and bounce, left alone
length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover from the back foot
fuller around off, comes on the front foot and smothers
half a step forward and looks to defend. The ball hits the pad and lobs towards cover
down the track, reaches to the pitch and flicks it in front of square leg, finds the gap to perfection
length ball outside off, stays in his crease and defends
length ball around off, defended towards cover once again
beaten and kept low as well. Was a length ball outside off and Pant tries to push at it
a bouncer angling across the batsman. Pant is happy to duck under it
fuller on the stumps, gets behind it and blocks
short of length outside off, dabs it towards backward point. Pujara was interested in a single but Pant does the wise thing and sends him back. No need for those at this moment
fuller around off, uses his feet to drive it towards mid-on
length ball around off and middle, stays back and defends
half a step forward to pad it away. An appeal for lbw by Lyon but the umpire isn't interested. The HawkEye confirms it would have missed the off stump
short of length and some room as well. Pujara creates further by going back. Cuts it through covers for four
length ball on the stumps, turns it towards short midwicket
uses his feet once again and pads it away. Was pitched well outside off
back of length on off, defended on the back foot
snorter of a bouncer that's hit him on the helmet. Pant was going for the pull but was late on it, and he's pinged on the left side of the helmet. The ball rolls through the slips area.
back of a length down leg, doesn't rise much, pulled from waist high to fine leg
banged in short outside off, but too short and too far away from off to have Pujara do anything other than watch it go
short again, but down the other side this time, too far down leg
short and very far down legside again. Pujara doesn't even have to move
fuller on the stumps, steps out and drives along the ground to long-on
uses his feet again, gets to the pitch and whips off his toes to square leg. In fact it pinged short leg on the bounce and went off
comes on the front foot to defend this towards mid-on from outside off
dragged the length shorter - Pujara's use of feet certainly making Lyon alter plans - and Pujara stays back to cut it to point's right
dances down the track again, not completely to the pitch but defends it solidly enough to silly mid-off's left
length outside off, punched to point

audacious but typically of Pujara it's safe too. Short ball cramping him for room outside off, and Pujara rises up with the ball to slash it over slips and and to the third man boundary. No fielder back there, so it was safe
bouncer, but down leg, easily ducked under
better directed bouncer, over off stump. Pujara was getting into position to pull but realised the ball was climbing too steeply and let it go over his head
back of a length angling in on off, defended on the back foot
length on the pads, Pujara turns it through midwicket to get to 6000 Test runs.
bouncer on leg stump, Pant pulls it from near his shoulder by getting inside the line. Keeps it down and fine leg fields

chops it down and it bounces to slip. Quicker one outside off, Pant was making room to cut. Bounced just before the boot of first slip. That actually came off Paine's pad, which made it even harder for first-slip Smith to hold on
tossed up on the stumps, pushed to cover
fuller, comes on the front foot and nudges this through where short leg would have been
length outside off, turning into him, flicked with the turn to short fine leg
good length on off, defended on the front foot
a bit shorter, and allows him to go back and whip off his pads to square leg
Shot. Pulled in just before the cover boundary by a sprinting Warner. This was full outside off and Pant unfurled a free-flowing cover drive by planting his front foot forward
back of a length on off, defended on the back foot
goes wider of the crease and angles a full ball into his pads. flicked into the legside
a rarity. Test match wide. Too short and too far down leg
full on the pads, flicked to square leg
length in the channel, steered towards point
some swing into him but Pujara negotiates it comfortably, pushing to mid-on's left for a single
tossed up on off, comes down the track, bat behind pad. Ball hits pad and rolls away
tossed up more, comes down the track and takes it on the half volley, flicks to midwicket
tossed up well outside off again, Pujara pads it away towards point

drags it short and Pujara picks the gap expertly to raise his second fantastic fifty of the game. Went back and flicks it off his pads, through short leg's feet. Once past that man close in, there's a big gap to pick
fuller on the stumps, defended
tossed up outside off, down the track again and this time with bat in front of pad, defends into the offside
length ball on a sixth stump line. Pant ignores it.

flays it through point but there's some risk in that shot too. Green tempting him with the wide line outside off and Pant goes for it, goes hard too, and beats the man at deep cover who is running to his right
and that goes off the outside edge. Same line wide outside off and Pant goes hard at it again. Gets a thick edge that flies over gully
another full ball well wide of off, this time too Pant reaches for it, drives to cover
brings the line a lot more straight, on off, confidently punched back to the bowler
back to full and wide outside off, this time Pant shoulders arms
down the track, gets to the pitch again, and whips it to square leg's left
Pant also goes down the track and taps this to long-on's left
length outside off, spinning into him, hits him on the thigh pad, on the left leg, going down
fuller on the stumps, picked off his toes to backward square leg
takes on the wide long-on and beats him. This is exhilarating stuff by Pant. what a way to move into the 90s. Down the track and goes flat and straight with his on-drive. Beats the fielder
terrific batting. Pant is toying with Lyon. Down the track again, this time makes some room while doing so and essays a smoothly fluent cover drive that purrs all the way to the boundary.
Pujara gets into the act. Short ball on the ribs, swivels and pulls with authority to the square leg boundary
full on off, defended to mid-on
full, angling into him on off, gets behind it and defends solidly to mid-on
length on off again, defended solidly again
another solid forward defensive to a ball homing in on off stump.
back of a length and wider outside off, Pujara punches away from body to point

live by the sword, die by it. Lyon has got his man. He had five men back on the boundary. Pant, undeterred, danced down the track again. But Lyon got this a mite wider and Pant loses his shape trying to thrash it over cover, ends up splicing it to gully. Brings to a close an endlessly entertaining knock
length outside off, spinning in, defended by going across
tossed up fuller, comes on the front foot to tap towards midwicket
tossed up on off, big lunge forward to defend
tossed up outside off, and he's nicely forward again to defend
quicker, Vihari gets behind it and defends
on the money as ever, length on off, Pujara tucks it to midwicket, almost falling over while playing the shot
fuller on off, on the front foot to defend to mid-on
length ball coming into him, blocked to the bowler's left
back of a length outside off, Pujara lets it go through
that's seamed back in sharply. Back of a length outside off and jags in to hit Pujara in the midriff and roll away towards square leg
and this one moves away. Cummins never lets the batsman relax. Outside off and seaming away, lets it go
full on leg stump, turned into the leg side
full on the stumps, defended
full outside off, nice stride forward to cover drive, but he can't beat the man in the circle
sliding down leg, left alone
zooming into him on off, but he brings bat down in time to defend
length on a fifth stump, shoulders arms
too full and Pujara has been on-driving Cummins when he does that. Gets hold of it nicely and to the bowler's left, Cummins has hand outstretched but it eludes his finger tips
shot. Back of a length and a bit more room outside off instead of the tight line Cummins bowls and Pujara rocks back to punch through cover

Pant has not left the building, he's batting with Pujara's face mask. Three fours in a row off Cummins. But you know it's Pujara because each one is nicely controlled. This was pitched full on leg and Pujara drives through mid-on this time.
length into him, whipped to square leg
length, coming in on off, straight bat to mid-on
back of a length nipping in, ends up on the pads, flicks the pad to short leg
comes back in sharply and Vihari late on the defense, gets it on his thigh pad and the ball goes towards point
fuller but doing down leg.
length on off, defended towards gully
coming in sharply again, he was looking to clip it off his pads, but is a bit late on it again. Takes the pad and rolls to the offside
length ball coming into him, gently tapped to square leg. Vihari wants the single, Pujara sends him back - rightly as it turns out.
bouncer over the stumps, bends down and lets it go over his head.
short of length outside off, gets on his toes and defends it down square on the off side
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards midwicket
off the mark. Length ball on middle and leg, dabs it down towards fine leg
length ball around off and middle, works it towards short midwicket
fuller around off, defended solidly from the front foot
length ball around off, stands tall and defends it down
fuller outside off, driven firmly but silly mid-off comes in the way
length ball, looks to defend. Gets an inside edge on to the pads
whipped through midwicket, Pucovski puts in the dive to his right but fails to stop. Bumps his shoulder into the turf
fuller on the stumps, defended on the leg side
length outside off, pushed away
length ball on middle and leg, turns it towards backward square leg
An outside edge as Pujara looks to defend this length delivery on middle. Goes past Smith at second slip
fuller on the stumps, defended towards mid-on from the front foot
length ball on middle and leg, flicks it towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends
length ball around off and middle, tucked away towards short midwicket
fuller around off and middle, pushed on the leg side. The fielder in front of square leg stops it
uses his feet and thrusts his bat and pad at it. The ball spins to beat the bat. An appeal for lbw but denied. Don't think you can say Pujara was padding it away
pushes it towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball around off, moves across and turns it towards short leg. He is looking in trouble here, don't think he can take quick singles
a touch fuller and straighter, helped towards backward square leg
fuller around off, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball around off, gets behind this and blocks
short of length down the leg side, Pujara stays away from it

cleans him up. A length ball around off, Pujara was expecting it to come in with the angle but it holds its line. He looks to defend but ends up playing inside the line and is bowled. Is that the game?
length ball on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on and looks for a quick single but Vihari sends him back
short of length outside off, gets on his toes and defends
length ball outside off, pushes it towards backward point

length ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on but Vihari is struggling. Hobbling to the other end. A direct-hit and he was gone. Vihari had given up. I don't think India can take singles with Vihari at the crease
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and defends
too full outside off, smothered on the front foot
length ball around off, pushes it through covers. And they take a single. Vihari ran much better this time
length outside off, looks to defend but it keeps low and sneaks underneath the bat
length ball on the pads, worked towards square leg for one
length ball around off, stays back and defends
short but well outside off, Vihari ducks and sways away
length ball, pitching well outside off and coming back in. Left alone
short but down the leg side, ducked under easily
length ball around off, defended from the crease although not from the middle of the bat
length ball around off, defended solidly this time
length ball around off and spinning in a bit, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, comes forward and dead-bats it
length ball spinning in sharply. defended from the crease

an appeal for catch at short leg but denied. Australia want to review. Tossed up around off, Ashwin comes forward and looks to defend with bat-pad close. There is nothing on the Snicko. Regarding lbw, it would have gone down, and so Australia lose the review
fuller and wider, lunges forward and looks to defend but it spins past the bat and hits the back leg
jumps out of the crease and lofts it over mid-on, a couple of bounces and over the boundary line
length ball around off, defended
length ball angling in, stays back and blocks
length ball coming in with the angle and beats the bat as Vihari looks to defend
short of length outside off, punches it towards extra cover
length but way outside off, left alone
length ball on the stumps, defended from the crease
length ball around off and middle, defended
pushed square of the wicket, doesn't even think of a single
lunges forward and defends
comes forward and blocks again
fuller around off, defended on the front foot
a touch quicker this time, just outside off, Ashwin is happy to block it
length ball angling in, defended on the leg side
fuller outside off, comes forward and blocks it towards cover-point
fuller around off, defended from the front foot
short of length around off, defended towards cover
bowls a bumper, Vihari does well to duck under it
length ball outside off, taps it towards cover-point
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
pitched up outside off once more. A similar response from Ashwin, defended on the front foot
a touch straighter this time, pushes it back towards the bowler
length ball around off and spinning, turns it towards short leg
length ball, flatter and straighter around off, Ashwin was looking to defend from the back foot, the ball hits the outer half and rolls behind point, and they take a single
length ball around off, moves across and tucks it away towards square leg

given out caught off the bouncer but he's reviewing straightaway. Indicating it came off the arm guard. Snorter first up from Cummins, rises up to his face on leg stump as he's moving across and he's getting hands up to fend it off. The ball loops up beside him and Paine rushes in and dives full length to catch it. But Ashwin was right to review, that has not taken glove. Proper wake up call, first up.

another bouncer, but played it well enough in the end. Cummins is steaming in. Bangs it in outside off and rising to head height again, Ashwin getting his hands up to defend, but the ball goes over and pings him on the right shoulder. Took some glove on the way, and dropped into the short point region.
fuller on off, Ashwin solidly behind it to defend.
well played by Ashwin, he's not cowed into hanging on the back foot. Length ball on off, moves across and clips off his pads through midwicket.
back of a length on off, gets behind it and defends
bouncer but too short that time and goes over his head
length ball coming in on off, he's moving across slightly and defends down the pitch
full on off, nicely behind it to defend
another snorter. Ashwin's copping a fair bit, but this one doesn't hit him. Short outside off, climbing steeply and hisses past his grille
fuller on off, solid in defence

and once again. They are going to pepper the batsmen with the short stuff clearly. Bouncer on off and Ashwin can't get out of the way but he does drop his hands and wears it on his right shoulder. The ball rolls to slip
looped in the air but lands safely behind square leg Was moving across, tried to flick, got a top edge that went high. Lands safe. He's earned that bit of luck maybe, with the bouncers he's weathered
and another leading edge falls safe! Back of a length on off, he's moving across but weight on back foot, tries to tap it around but the leading edge goes over Cummins and lands safe
short into the ribs, gets inside the line to fend it down but that hit the bat near the handle
slips in the fuller one on off, and Ashwin flicks it through midwicket
length outside off, defended carefully towards gully
full again but down legside. Vihari looking to flick but the ball goes past him down leg
bouncer to finish but too short, easy enough to duck under
back at the ribs, Ashwin negotiates it safely tapping down in the legside near him
and he decides to take on the short stuff now, swivels inside the line and pulls, but can't beat backward square leg
full on off, jabbed towards short cover
fuller, going down leg, he's going well across, tries to flick it but misses
back of a length, he's moving across again, flicks it off his waist to fine leg
length on a sixth stump line, safely left alone
short to start with but down leg side, Ashwin's moving across anyway and lets it go

and one of the short balls has pinged him on the ribs. Ashwin went down, he's rubbing his chest too. This was another hostile ball, rising up at the rib cage. Ashwin tries to keep it down while moving across but can't get bat on it and the blow is a painful one.
back of length outside off, pushes it to point

thick edge flies to third man. He was looking to get behind the ball, another short one, outside off, takes the shoulder of the bat and flies off. Bit of luck, but he's earned that but gutsing through this period

short again, and this time he goes back to pull, makes connection. Fielder at square leg flies to his right, gets hands to it, but drops it. Would have been an incredible take. Sean Abbot the fielder, on for Pucovski.
back of length again, into him tapped into the legside
length on off, turned into the legside
tossed up on off, driven firmly to mid-off
flicks it off his pads to square leg
tossed up fuller, driven to mid-on's left
tossed up outside off, stretches forward to defend
too short, goes back and punches through midwicket. Large enough gap to jog a single - and they can only jog them given Vihari's injury
yorker on off stump, Vihari stays very still and calmly defends to mid-on
back of a length outside off, pushed towards cover
length outside off, defended
and there's the bouncer, but a bit too short and he ducks under
length on leg stump, tucked to square leg
length ball but sliding down leg and Vihari's happy to let it slide
tossed up on off, comes on the front foot to defend to mid-on
fuller, gets it to drift into the right hander but Ashwin lunges forward to defend
tossed up again, defended on the front foot again
nice loop on that outside off, but Ashwin's reach helping him stride out to the pitch and defend
he's keeping it nibbling around that off stump line, Ashwin happy to defend on the front foot
ends the over in the same way. Fuller ball on off, defended on the front foot
full outside off, and leans into the cover drive. Finds the gap, but it'll be no run since Vihari is not going to run
back of a length outside off, punched through point. He'll jog the single this time
moving well inside the line and this is a short ball that is outside leg, so he ends up well clear of it
back of a length going across him, he gets in line and defends down the track
another short ball but it's well down leg and Ashwin is moving considerably across to counter the short stuff. This one is well clear
back of a length and closer to leg stump now, Ashwin trying to flick while walking across, misses
length outside off, spinning into him, worked to short fine leg

Lyon goes down and nearly screams his lungs out in appeal. How do you not review if you are going to appeal like that? They don't review. Tossed up outside off, he's coming forward to defend, looks like he's playing a shot to me and is struck outside the line.
length outside off, defended on the front foot
tapped to the bowler's right
length ball, goes across and clips to mid-on
tossed up fuller outside off, comes on the front foot and defends into the legside
well directed short ball after the spray down leg previous over, Ashwin moves across and taps it down near him from his ribs
short ball outside off, gets behind it and defends to mid-off
short ball but once again down leg and he just bends a little to avoid going anywhere near it
another short ball, closer to leg stump but still outside it. Starc's short stuff not as well directed as Cummins and Hazlewood so far
back of a length on off, gently defended down to short leg
length on the stumps, patted back to the bowler. Frustration from Starc as he has a bit of a shy at the stumps, but Vihari doesn't even need to move to avoid that. Paine gathers
length outside off spinning into him, goes back and clips to backward square leg
tossed up outside off, stretches forward to defend
outside off again, defended into the offside
tossed up fuller, comes on the front foot and whips forward of square. The square leg runs to his left and slides to stop it.
tossed up outside off fuller, and Ashwin leans into a crisp punch that beats mid-off. Green from mid-on haring after it and puts in the dive but can't pull it in. Boundary to Ashwin
very full again and Ashwin drives again, this time with an open bat face and the balls purrs to the point boundary
length outside off, punched towards point
bouncer on off, arches his back to sway out of the way
length on off, defended back to the bowler
length ball angling into him, punched back
offcutter but that is well wide of off. No way is Vihari going to stretch his hamstring to get near that
back of a length into him, keeps it down on the legside
steered towards point on the front foot
length spinning into him, turned off his pads to square leg
comes on the front foot to defend it back to the bowler
tossed up on leg stump this time but he's calmly forward on the front foot and defends to mid-on
fuller on the stumps, tapped into the legside on the front foot
length on the stumps, goes back and works it off his pads. Bounces to short leg
full on off, blocked back down the pitch
length on the stumps, punched to mid-on
almost got through him. Got this to come back in and Vihari was pushing forward to defend, gets an inside edge onto pad
length angling into him, turned to short leg
full on the stumps. The injury is making Vihari stay extremely still and that's perhaps helped him negotiate some of the bowling. Defended towards mid-on
past the outside edge. Length ball in the channel, he might have been expecting it to tail into him, was playing inside the line and it goes past
length outside off, spinning away, left alone
tossed up on the stumps, fully forward to defend
too short and spinning away outside off, slaps it to deep point. They're not taking the single
fuller outside off, opens the face to steer it to point on the front foot. Not running again
tossed up outside off again and Ashwin punches it to the deep point. I think India have decided there's no point stressing Vihari's hamstring and having Ashwin face Hazlewood. So no run
full toss and Ashwin launches a full-blooded drive at that, which hits silly point
bouncer, but going down leg side, ducked under
fuller on the pads, flicked to square leg. Good timing on that, but straight to the fielder
full on the pads, flicked off his toes through midwicket. They don't take the run again
fended off but lands safe. Don't think he was expecting the short one, was stuck on the crease and this was directed at his ribs, ends up fending it through the backward short leg area
fuller, pushing forward to defend and this one tailed in late, he gets an inside edge that flies past short leg
fuller length on a fifth stump line, coming in but safely left alone since that won't threaten off stump
goes down on one knee and unfurls a square drive but can't beat cover
fuller outside off, opens the bat face to steer to gully region
drifts in a bit and on the stumps, solidly defended on the front foot
good length, spinning away from outside off, left alone
length on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
full toss outside off, punches it forcefully through point. No single taken still
fuller on the pads, it takes the pad and goes towards fine leg. Vihari wasn't offering a shot so no runs, but they're not running anyway
length on the stumps, punched through midwicket. They're not taking the single
fuller on the stumps, jams his bat down in defence. Plays it straight. Wade at short leg leaps up to field it with his left hand and has a shy that hits Vihari's boot
bouncer, but over leg stump, ducks under
length on off, nipping away, Vihari was well behind it and deep in his crease so he's able to squirt it away towards cover
yorker, tailing into him, and it's squeezed through square leg at the last moment off an inside edge
starts with a bouncer but Vihari had no problem ducking under it
another bouncer but way down the leg side and balloons up. Called a wide
length ball around off, Vihari stays in the crease and defends
short of length around off, turns it towards short leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
pitched up, just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
short of length but down the leg side, left alone
short of length around off, gets on the toes and defends
length ball on the stumps, Ashwin is right behind it and defends
short of length just outside off, rising towards the batsman but Ashwin does well to get on the top of it and drop it at his feet
goes for the inswinging yorker, just misses his length. Ashwin is watchful and presents the full face of the bat
once again goes for the yorker but this time ends up bowling a low full toss, Ashwin clips it through midwicket
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
pitched up outside off, lunges forward and blocks again
spinning back sharply from outside off, Vihari looks to defend but gets a leading edge towards point
length ball spinning big, Vihari misses the flick and is hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but was going down
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and defends
starts with a short one down the leg side, helped towards fine leg. And they take a single
another bouncer, this time well directed. Vihari ducks under easily though
another sharp bouncer, puts Vihari in an awkward position but he does well to fend it down. A desperate dive from Wade at short leg but it was still away from him
fuller outside off, driven towards mid-off with a decent front-foot stride. He overstepped there, so one more ball to negotiate for India
short again, on middle and leg, Vihari ducks under it
another short one, a tad further down the leg side, Vihari isn't looking to play at those. Gets under it once again
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it under his eyes
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller and wider, Ashwin drives it through covers, a big gap there and he gets a boundary
fuller on the stumps, Ashwin moves across and nudges it on the leg side
length ball on the stumps, Ashwin once again moves across and looks to flick but misses and is struck on the pad. An appeal for lbw but denied. Was going down
length ball at the stumps, gets behind it and blocks watchfully
length ball on the pads, flicked away but short leg is in the way
short outside off, Vihari bends his back and dabs it over gully for four
slower bouncer but down the leg side. Vihari moves away from it
quicker bouncer this time but once again down the leg side, Vihari leaves it alone once again
length ball outside off, keeps a touch low. Vihari looks to defend, gets a thick outside edge past the slip fielder
back to the bouncer. On the stumps this time. Vihari once again ducks under
an appeal for lbw but was going down. Length ball on the stumps, misses the flick and is hit high on the thigh
fuller on the pads, defended from the front foot
pitched up around middle and leg, blocked again
length ball at the stumps, defended on the front foot
fuller around off, comes forward to defend. It spins past the bat to hit the pad. An appeal for lbw but the impact was outside off
length ball on the stumps, Ashwin was moving towards the off side but does well to adjust and block it
length ball spinning down the leg side, goes for the flick but misses. An appeal for caught-behind, given not out
fuller outside off, driven towards mid-off from the front foot
short of length, rising towards the batsman, takes the bottom hand off and drops it down
short outside off, gets on the toes and defends it down on the off side
almost there. Fuller on the stumps, Vihari looks to flick it on the leg side, gets a leading edge through point that is stopped just inside. Vihari is not interested in running

Paine has dropped a catch. Is that the Test as well?
